headline: Sam Altman Weighs An $830B–$1T IPO And Admits Running A Public Company Could Be 'Really Annoying'
summary: A potential mega IPO is coming into focus, but enthusiasm for life as a public-company CEO appears limited. "Am I excited to be a public company CEO? 0%," OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on the "Big Technology Podcast." "Am I excited for OpenAI to be a public company? In some ways, I am, and in some ways I think it'd be really annoying." He told host Alex Kantrowitz that while public markets can play a role in value creation, leading a public company comes with trade-offs he does not find appealing.

headline: Investor Michael Burry Reveals Options Bet Against Oracle
summary: Burry owns put options on Oracle shares, he said in a Substack post after markets closed on Friday.  Burry, who revealed bearish bets against AI chipmaker Nvidia Corp. and Palantir Technologies Inc. in November, also directly shorted Oracle during the last six months, he said.
